abstract: European regulators approved Johnson & Johnson’s $21 billion acquisition of the medical equipment maker Synthes on Thursday after the company agreed to divest part of its European operations.
snippet: European regulators approved Johnson & Johnson’s $21 billion acquisition of the medical equipment maker Synthes on Thursday after the company agreed to divest part of its European operations.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — European regulators approved Johnson & Johnson’s $21 billion acquisition of the medical equipment maker Synthes on Thursday after the company agreed to divest part of its European operations.

headline.main: European Regulators Approve J.&J.’s Takeover of Synthes
